workout_file.description: Foundation training: Relatively low intensity ride with goal of spending a large proportion of the ride into Endurance Zone 2.
workout_file.name: Week 4.1 - Foundation

textevent.message: Welcome back for week 4 of the 6 Week Beginner FTP Builder! Let's get started with a warmup.
Let's also do a quick check to make sure you have your bottle, towel, and fan all set.
Keep on easing into the day here. Hopefully you can feel the pedal stroke becoming more fluid.
That's halfway through our warmup, let's run down what's in store for today.
We'll continue our Foundation training today, aiming for 48mins at zone 2 today.
This is up from 36mins last week, but you got it! :-)
We only have 1min easy between our 8mins at zone 2 intervals today too, so even more work for the same rest.
This, again, sticks with the plan's goal of progressively overloading the body and causing it adapt.
With the goal of raising your FTP of course!
1min to go, then we're going right into our first interval set.
All right, we're starting off at 90-100 RPM for this first interval, nothing fancy.
Let's steady out the power now and aim for a faster cadence. We're here for 8mins.
3mins into it so far. You should be nice and settled down here and have found your rhythm.
That's halfway! If you're feeling good, push the cadence up close to 100 RPM.
2mins to go here! Make sure you're keeping your cadence up!
1min left, then we're taking a short 1min rest. Keep those legs spinning!
Excellent! Let's take it nice and easy for a bit here. Take a few sips of fluid.
Next up, we're going to spend 90sec seated at 100 RPM, with 30sec standing at 70 RPM.
Make the transitions smooth here, and get in some practice standing if you're not used to it.
All right, we're starting off seated at 100 RPM, let's go!
In 10sec, shift down a few gears harder to slow your cadence, then stand up.
Stand up! We're here for 30sec. If you have any knee discomfort, please sit back down and lift your cadence again.
Good! Now shift back up a few gears easier and resume 100 RPM. We'll do that 3 more times.
Get ready to stand up again. Remember, make these transitions smooth.
Stand up!
And back to sitting again. How do you feel standing?
If it's awkward, you need to be practicing it more.
Standing again! Shift the gears to slow your leg speed more efficiently, even using ERG.
And back to sitting again. This is the last rep for these, keep it up!
Ready to stand 1 last time? Get ready.
And stand up! Slow that leg speed down.
Superb! Standing is always something good to practice if you're not used to it.
We want to make more well rounded cyclists after all :-) Short break again, use it well.
All right, our for our 3rd interval set, we're going to be doing a progressive cadence ramp. We start at 90 RPM.
All right, let's start at 90 RPM for these first 2mins. Steady as you go here.
Next up, we're going to lift the cadence slightly to 95 RPM.
Give me a little more leg speed now, but keep your form solid here.
Our last step is going to be at 100 RPM for 4mins, and we'll start that in 30sec.
Here we go, FAST FEET!
Keep your hips planted on the saddle, no bouncing here.
Final minute! Keep those legs spinning and don't let your cadence drop off now!
30sec left! Keep that cadence up!
Awesome work! Just 3 intervals to go :-) Let's take a few deep breaths here and sip some fluid.
For our next interval I want to incorporate some position work, at a steady 90-100 RPM.
Let's start on the hoods in a comfortable position.
Here we go. Start off in a comfortable position for this first minute, and just find the rhythm here.
Okay, now, let's get into a more aero position. Grab your drops, or get into your flat bars if you're on a TT bike.
Let's try to stay here for 3mins, but if you can't, just do your best.
Reducing drag is one of the easiest way to go faster on the bike, and working in this position is the way to do that.
Imagine trying to reduce your frontal area as much as possible, so the wind has nothing to buffet against.
Okay, let's resume a comfortable position again, but if you still feel good, stay down.
Get back down again if you're up now, let's finish these last 3mins here.
Last minute, stick with it as long as you can!
Great work! Come back up again to a comfortable position and let's take a quick rest.
Next up, we're going to repeat the first interval and just aim for 90-100 RPM the entire time.
Ready? Start bringing the cadence up here.
This cadence level should be easier to adjust to by now, spin those legs!
3mins into it so far. You should be nice and settled down here and have found your rhythm.
That's halfway! Keep those legs turning over quickly here.
2mins to go here! Make sure you're keeping your cadence up!
Push it all the way to the arch!
BOOM! Just 1 interval to go today, then we're done.
Take a few sips of fluid here and a couple deep breaths.
All right, for our final interval, I want to do some more standing work. Let's get into it.
All right, we're starting off seated at 100 RPM, let's go!
In 10sec, shift down a few gears harder to slow your cadence, then stand up.
Stand up! We're here for 30sec. If you have any knee discomfort, please sit back down and lift your cadence again.
Good! Now shift back up a few gears easier and resume 100 RPM. We'll do that 3 more times.
Get ready to stand up again. Remember, make these transitions smooth.
Stand up!
And back to sitting again. How do you feel standing?
If it's awkward, you need to be practicing it more.
Standing again! Shift the gears to slow your leg speed more efficiently, even using ERG.
And back to sitting again. This is the last rep for these, keep it up!
Ready to stand 1 last time? Get ready.
And stand up! Slow that leg speed down.
Way to go! That was the hardest Foundation workout yet, but you handled it well!
We're going to spend a few minute cooling down now, then we have another one in the books.
Enjoy the last few minutes of the cool down, and we'll see you next time!
